definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: The glut of shipping capacity has forced down rates.
sentences.chinese: 航运量的供过于求已经造成了利率下滑。

sentences.english: From telecoms to insurance, China is full of service oligopolies that need to be broken up.
sentences.chinese: 从电信到保险，中国供过于求的服务现状应当被打破。

sentences.english: Price-cutting at many hotels suggests there may be a glut of rooms.
sentences.chinese: 许多旅店纷纷降价，预示着或许房屋供过于求。

sentences.english: Pig farmers cut back on production after losing money during last year's glut.
sentences.chinese: 去年供过于求亏损之后，养猪户缩小了养殖规模。

sentences.english: Business in accordance with market practice, when an over-supply of production should be reduced.
sentences.chinese: 按照生意场上的常规，供过于求时就应该减少生产。

sentences.english: And I am so tired of the concept of “inventory glut.”
sentences.chinese: 而且我对“供过于求”这个概念感觉实在是太烦了。

sentences.english: Overexpansion of tea fields has led to oversupply.
sentences.chinese: 茶园过度扩张，使得市场上逐渐供过于求。

sentences.english: But what of our natural gas glut?
sentences.chinese: 但是天然气供过于求怎么办？

sentences.english: The market is saturated with gooda used cars.
sentences.chinese: 市场上质量好的旧汽车供过于求。

sentences.english: The Iranian Oil Minister Gholam-Hussein Nozari said more than enough oil is being supplied.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗石油部长诺扎利说，目前石油供过于求。

definition: property or cash held in reserve/stock
lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom)/fig. not enough to go around/demand exceeds supply
